result.execSummary:
The defendant Treon D. Vaughn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Treon D. Vaughn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Treon D. Vaughn was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Treon D. Vaughn was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Lara Parker, special prosecutor, appearing for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Scott Anderson.  The DE plead guilty to cts. 6 & 7, found guilty.  Cts. 1,2,3,4 & 5 dismissed.  
Sentence as follows:
Ct. 6
9 months KCJ, credit for time served 9 months

Ct. 7
9 months KCJ, credit for time served 9 months
concurrent to ct. 6.

Fees & costs due in 30 days or civil judgment.   
Extradition costs of $499.01 due.
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. 
Previously imposed contempt finding (30 days KCJ) vacated.  
Clerk D. Smith.

Atty Lara Parker, special prosecutor, appearing for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Scott Anderson who appeared by phone.  The DE has agreed to the State's offer.  Plea/Sentencing 8/14/17 @ 8:30.  Clerk D. Smith.
3/1/17 - Hearing

Atty Lara Parker, special prosecutor, appearing for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Scott Anderson, who appeared by phone.  The DE is requesting an adjournment as he has not had adequate time to speak with his attorney.  The court grants the request & calendars a further proceedings on 8/11/17 @ 8:15.  Atty. Anderson may appear by phone for the hearing on 8/11/17 if the case is not resolved and is only getting a new jury trial date.  He will have to appear if the case is resolved.  Clerk D. Smith.
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Scott Anderson. FPT 7/21/17 @ 11:00 & jury selection 7/24/17 @ 8:45.  Clerk D. Smith.

Atty. Anderson was just appointed and is not available for the hearing on 3/13/17 @ 8:30.  The hearing with be rescheduled to a date when he is available.
Atty Scott Anderson
for Contempt  -  Deft to serve 30 days consecutive to any other time being served.  The 30 days does not start until after he is sentenced or no longer subject to bond.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney James J. Ermert who is requesting to withdraw as counsel.  The court grants the request.  The DE is found in contempt for disruption of the court.  He is given the right of allocution.  The court orders 30 days incarceration consecutive to any other time being served.  The time is to be served after he is sentenced or when he is no longer under obligation of bond.  Further proceedings 3/13/17 @ 8:30.  Clerk D. Smith.
Atty James Ermert
to Withdraw.  Atty Brett Ekes is allowed to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.

Court grants Atty Ekes's motion to withdraw as counsel, for the reasons stated on the record.  Public Defender to appoint new counsel for def.  Status conf. re attorney status on 3/1/17 at 10:00, per Judge.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motion to compel discovery heard. Substitution of Br 3 filed. No action taken today.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 12/22/15 @ 8:15 a.m.  Bond - continued.  Atty Hertz-McGrath questions deft competency - court finds deft competent after questioning.  Attyorney moves to dismiss cts #7 -court takes under advisement.

from DE re: scheduling of preliminary hearing

Atty  D Hertz-McGrath.

Defendant Treon D. Vaughn in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   State is prepared for preliminary hearing, but is questioning the competency of the DE due to a letter received from Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Court questions DE. Court finds DE is competent.   DE states his family is looking to hire an attorney.  DE is asking for an adjournment of the preliminary hearing.   Court tolls time limits.  Atty Status hearing to be set after DE next hearing on his case in Br 4.   Bond continued.  Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
